comment: Great scent and flavor! Smooth finish with tremendous bosy
A real treat. Very earthy tasting without being peaty. Fresh and unique.
This was wonderfully smooth and an obvious treat.  Almost impossible to attain a bottle so I suggest treating yourself to a pour at a local restaurant.    GTS
Probably the best whiskey I've ever had.
Long finish w bold and round textures.
You will be mine, oh yes, you will be mine!
Even with a 1oz pour was an amazing whiskey, very clean,  a lot of honey/vanilla tones and a joy to drink. Even my no-whiskey wife was amazed.
Absolutely horrible stuff. I sold my bottle after tasting a friends.  It was terrible in every way.  Don't buy this crap.
A little too spicy for my liking
Vanilla and toffee... A lovely combination!
Best bourbon I've tasted. Each glass tastes different once uncorked. My last glass was like drinking pure honey suckle from the from the forest. Amazing complexity and variety over time.
worth the msrp of $130-150. but not the time to try to get a bottle. the 15 yr is much better and raw base expression to try
I'm so sad that I've drank it all
Good, though I like the 15 more.
Love the 20  much more notes of fruitiness than the 23
The best I've ever had. A 92 is way under rated
The flavor lingers.  That's a good thing.
Damn good but heavy on the oak.

Smooth mouthfeel. Oaky, slight alcohol burn when smelling, smooth and aged flavour with warm and smooth/sweet taste and warm feeling after swallow.  Leather and tobacco light flavours after.  Slight tongue bitter after several sips.  Amazing smooth and rich with vintage character bourbon!(overhyped, but would be worth retail) A+
Hands down best I've had. Smooth, supple, perfect for celebrations and milestones. Need to taste 15, 23.
Very sweet but not syrupy, with a touch of fire (from the wheat?) Super smooth finish

One of the two best bourbons I've ever had, this sticks out like a sore thumb after the first sip. What's surprising is how DEEP the flavor is. There's also an incredible warmth without being invasive. Classic bourbon flavors are on full display.
This is a very unique taste of Bourbon. It is very smooth and tasty.  A little pricey but worth it.  This is more of a sipping drink, not to be mixed.

Nose: home made ice cream, buttered and charred toast, bubble gum, carribean fruits, golden melons, passion fruits, dark blueberries, blackberry tarts, tart orange fine, ripe lemons, menthol, tobacco, tons of refined woody notes, cedar bark, redwood sap, mahogany wood finished, cake frosting, french vanilla, raw brown sugar, new tires, fresh cut grass,caddied taffy, bread dough uncooked, rose flavored gelato, rich warm caramel, vanilla dipped bananas. Pallet: candy sweet entry with candied cherries, menthol char, sherry and slow spice that lingers into oak.  Finish: candied caramels, char, caddied fruits and saltwater taffy.
Sooo good. Nice for a special night out. Great flavor. However, for the similar Whiskeys out there on the market, it is pretty over priced.

Scored a bottle at retail after one helluva quest.  Was terrified I'd be disappointed but that wasn't even close to the reality. Thus actually surpassed expectations. The nose is amazing. The balance on the palate is perfect. The finish is long and mellow. It's almost like the whiskey is just absorbed by your mouth with each sip.  I couldn't be happier and don't see how I'll ever find a better bourbon.

Was lucky to receive this as a gift in 2011, still part of the old Stitzel-Weller stock and have been enjoying it slowly on special occasions ever since.

A truly fantastic aged wheater.
I mean what's realy to say it's like tasting gold! I am not sure if the name or the taste is epic ! Great smooth taste

I was fortunate enough to sip some with a young friend that recently obtained a bottle, Xmas 2015. Wow, very nice. Strong, strong nose of vanilla and other spices. The finish was extremely long and very satisfying. I savored every sip which we both enjoyed neat. Followed it up with the latest Evan Williams 10 Year, Single Barrel Vintage, which has a very nice, strong nose, and it really pointed out the quality of the Pappy, especially the lingering finish.
Was fortunate enough to get a bottle two years in a row. Great depth and complexity that one expects from a Scotch.
Finally got to try it    2/23/15.    Smokey with nice pal taste.   More smooth / mild than I would have expected.   Lots of vanilla and smoke but not really smokey.   Very good
Oh my! The woody notes really make this sing and balance the sweeter flavors that typically dominate bourbon. Long, long finish. Tasted at WhiskyFest New York 2015.

Tried all Pappy Van Winkles on flight in Frankfurt Kentucky. The 20 year ranked third out of four for me. It lacked the character and flavor of the 15 year and the smooth oakiness of the 23 year. Did smell the best though

Very good, but overhyped. Redbreast was just as good and half the cost. I went to a swanky bar on 5th ave in Manhattan and I asked the waiter if they had redbreast, bring me it neat, otherwise bring me a list. He brought it to me neat and said "The bartender would like to commend you on your choice". It was pretty cool to have that said to me in front of my wife. I felt like I was in a commercial for the stuff. Not sure how this ended up in a pappy review. I like pappy. Just overpriced because of the hype.
Was happy to get this in '14.  It's a full palate of flavor.  Hopeful the stock continues to grow.
Drinkable and delicious but needs slightly more proof or richness, light and sweet but not strong enough to be engaging.
I've only ever had it once, but I regained my faith in God after sampling it.
Amazing, smooth bourbon with definite wood notes.   Had it alongside the 15, and preferred the 15, but this is great stuff as well!
Amazing nose so sweet.  Plums, raisins, caramel, leather for me.

~$180
The best bourbon I've ever had in my life. One day I will try the entire collection.
Very smooth upfront, followed by subtle smokey flavor, finish is very light but lingers well.
American whiskey, you generally get 1-3 flavors. Japanese 4-5. Pappy 20 year, 7 flavors from the start to finish. Let it sit on your tongue in small doses and endulge in the experience.
4/6 of the Van Winkle flight. My favorite of the bunch. So smooth and woody.

Everybody knows this is good juice.  But is it as great as the hype?  I don't think so.  Great nose on it, lots of oak and leather.  Oak, leather, some cinnamon and vanilla on tasting it.  I really think that the 15 year old is the high mark for the Pappy line up.

A buddy found it in Kentucky and snuck home a glass for me.  Unbelievable stuff, I could nose this for days.  Smoothest bourbon I've had; distinct flavors of maple, buttered popcorn and vanilla.  A bucket list type of drink.  Expert score on this one is way off base.

A 91/92 is fair.  It's high quality stuff done to the best of USA abilities but will never hit the highs of real scotch. When I drank the 20 yr old I sold my bottle of the 23 yr old for a tidy profit.  Ah you say - bad move - no - I could buy 2 bottles of 25 yr old macallan with the dough. Think of that...

SBS taste of all 5 Pappys. The 20 was voted best unanimously by all 12. Great evening of food, drink and fellowship.
Nose was sweet molasses with oak and new leather. Taste of maple syrup on French Toast. Red berries and hint of banana underneath. Very soft and easy with a cedar and mint fresh finish. 
Over hyped? No, it's excellent and every bourbon drinker should take advantage if the opportunity comes.
Hands down the best whiskey I've had. Starts with a burn but once it settles, creamy and caramel notes dance on places you didn't know existed in your tongue.
One of my favorites.  Smooth with no burn. Don't pay over $225
Great shooter after a loooong keg stand. 🍻

Sweet apples on the nose, with honey, caramel, and oak. Extremely smooth on the palate, velvety. Flavors aren't muted at all, but not as instense as the 15. Spice kicks in at the end. Layered. Apples, pecans, cinnamon, leather, salted butter even. 12/13/17
High alcohol upfront with a smooth and complex finish
Undoubtedly in the upper echelon of American whiskeys. That said, anyone that pays today’s allocation-manipulated price point for any of the “Pappy” offerings has more money than brains.
Lower proof but more refined than the 15. Not paying $1200 for a bottle, but would be up there in best bourbon I’ve had.
Smoothest bourbon ever tasted, no bite, no burn,  so mellowed tho almost no flavor.  Oily water

Dusty, deep oak with marzipan and a very well balanced wheat component. Long finish with raisin, furniture, and a sparkly wheat component. I get the hype but there is so much more you could buy for the money. This is a solidly great bourbon, but there’s many of those that are cheaper and more readily accessible than this. Thanks Martin for the pour!
Mild, dry, woody,harsh smell, smooth finish,

A very good bourbon without a doubt but way overpriced and overhyped. I’ll take a nice bottle of Blantons Gold or Belle Meade barrel strength and keep the significant amount of change. 4 for value vs price. 5 for drinkability and flavor.
smokey, floral citrus, herbal. extremely smooth with a long finish
For the price, for all the hype around this, it was just a base level bourbon to me.
wow!!! at whisky cake in clear lake Tx, fantastic on a single cube!!!!!
Just not good. Not the worst. But not good.
initial sweetness from corn and fruit. followed by oak and depth, cinnamon. finish is sweetness again.
Amazingly smooth and clean. Lived up to the hype

Tried this Pappy for the first time in 2002.  It cost me $70 at the time. It was indescribably wonderful. However, since folks with more money than impulse control have driven the price into outer space, I'll chose to not go where some had never gone before. Still, I can only hope that sanity will return to the marketplace.

This is an amazing bottle of bourbon, no doubt. Once you’ve have a dram of Pappy, you’ll remember that taste forever. I’ve had it a few times and it really has a distinct flavor profile and nose. Weller is the closest you can get. However, you can find better for a fraction of the cost.

Nose: chocolate covered cherries, creme brulee, vanilla, delicate cinnamon, maple syrup.  The nose is rich, complex, and delicious from the start.

Palate: the cinnamon comes out strong, nice oaky wood spice, and a nice touch of the maple syrup.

Finish: long, oak, and a little sweet.

Overall: first time trying thus and did not disappoint.  I found the hype to be real. This was delicious all around though the nose stands out as the brightest spot for this one.  Must try if you get the chance.
good flavor and strong notes of spice and oak.
Whiskey heaven! All the authentic rich notes of bourbon and easy to sip. I prefer its lower proof to the popular 15 year.
Incredibly smooth. Best bourbon I’ve had
probably my favorite of the pappy lineup. If you can find it at a reasonable price, do it

5/6 1/2 oz pours pappy Van Winkle flight. Out of this world, somewhere in between the bright and vibrant 15 and oaky 23. Notes of orange, leather, caramel, chocolate, and coffee with a rye spice finish. Either this or 23 was the best.

The hype isn't for no reason. It does have a little more burn on the end than expected, but other than that, it's worth the money for a pour if you can find it. I'll remember the nose and taste forever. Nothing like it.

My coworker hooked me up with a sample of Pappy 20, which I’m super gracious for. I’ll never have this again, so I figure I should write my thoughts 

Look: Dark amber, really shoes it’s age with the color that 20 comes out as. Lacing graces our presence with alcohol legs making an appearance as well. 

Nose: It’s rare that I smell a whisky and think “wow this smells like wood” but Pappy 20 smells like wood. After that note, I get some fruit, really just cherry and some sugary sweet notes, ie brown sugar. Slight spices, not hot notes ala cinnamon but more muted baking spices. 
Edit: All if a sudden, I’m getting peach in the nose and I love that. 

Palate: Good God, this is way hotter and spicier than I would’ve figured. First thing: oak, pepper, followed by some more mellow sweet notes. Brown sugar and vanilla really. I can get some cherry from the nose but it’s not nearly as much. Really, the dominant things I get are spice and oak. 

Finish: Light sweetness, vanilla is absolutely what I get, but there’s plenty of that bitter oak in the finish too. Long lingering, Pappy 20 really has a long finish. 

Overall: okay, as much as you here about Pappy, I’m a bit underwhelmed. After trying enough whisky in my life, I’m realizing I don’t maybe like overly aged bourbon with a lot of oak. That said, still a great bourbon. The stone fruit really bumps up the flavor now that I get that, and bumps the rating up.

I can’t pin down the nose on this one (aside from vanilla), but the flavor profile is (of course) woody. In addition, I’m getting some smokey citrus on the backend. Nice, but not what I’d expect for “The #1 rated bourbon in the world “.
So smooth, the wheated profile is simply excellent. The nose is generous and full of honey, palette is likely the best I’ve ever tasted. Long strong and smooth aftertaste.

Nose - Floral with cinnamon, pepper, honey and vanilla, with oak, leather and sweet pipe tobacco balancing it out. 

Palate - Delicate and nicely balanced with a burst of spice that doesn’t overwhelm, with pepper, cinnamon, honey, brown sugar, with molasses and vanilla evening it out. 

Finish - Oak, cinnamon and a touch of honey and corn sweetness linger for a long, smooth finish.
I mean it has to be a 5!? Better as it airs. Nose is divine, sweet .  Smooth criminal. Woody notes stick out for me. raisin ending. Changes completely every drink.
Strong vanilla bean. Super smooth. Delish on it's own but could easily see this with delicate fruity flavors
Worst decision of my life - now I need to empty the bank account and find a bottle to purchase.   Or win the lottery.

I must say it seemed like forever before the opportunity to try this presented itself.  I have had plenty of excellent bourbons before and while I was expecting this to disappoint it did not.  I’m fairly sure I’d never pay the insane secondary price for it but it did jump into my top three or four bourbons I have ever had.  I am a fan of the oak forward palate which presents almost an oak and cherry pie flavor.  Finish was super long and kept me going back in for more.  Truly excited and glad I got to try it.

Well damn. The nose is like pralines and cream ice cream, with toffee, caramel, freshly baked blondies, oak, oak, and more delicious oak. There’s also a note something like leaves in the Fall. Incredibly balanced and somehow not too oaky. The palate brings toasted candied pecans into focus, with a rich caramel, and a heavy toasted oak presence. The oaky tones almost remind me of the Rhetoric 24, but without the notes of the lumber department at Home Depot. There’s also a pleasant spice balancing out a modest sweetness. Much like the nose, the palate shows incredible balance and complexity. One flavor just flows into the next. The finish, which goes on for ages, is straight dark caramel, vanilla, and more oaky oakness. Oak. Damn this is good. 

$50 USD for a 1 oz pour
Great mouth feel; smooth finish virtually no burn. Reminds me of Elmer T Lee.... only crazy expensive..
Just a nip of a sample, but had to take the opportunity while it presented itself.
Truly unique; likely not a regular drinker because of delicate taste and cost; worth drinking for special occasions
Incredible! Initial aroma of strong vanilla, flavors of sweet vanilla, maple, and dolce de leche, so very smooth with a little cinnamon spice on the back end.
Lots of oak, brown sugar, touch of cinnamon and spice on the tongue. Super fortunate that a friend shared his bottle with me. Really pretty great.
Incredibly smooth.  Aromas of oak, vanilla and caramel shine through the nose. Superb mouthfeel with hints of fruit, vanilla and cinnamon.  Excellent.
One of my favorite Bourbons I have ever had. Great vanilla nose and wonderful carmel and vanilla palate with a super smooth finish.
Certainly a fine experience and grateful for it. But didn’t quite enjoy this one as much as the 15yr I tasted alongside this pour.
Delicious, very smooth, better than the 12
Seriously delicious. So smooth and the flavors just keep coming. I feel like I’m getting new waves of flavor 2-3 minutes after the first sip. Just awesome. Love it
Was not as deep and complex as I expect it should be for age.
Low proof and not much burn.

Nose : very sweet florals, rich caramel, golden raisins, 

Palate : Complex dried fruit character,
Lots of plum, raisin, and dates. Rich oak characteristics, with mellow citrus undertones mainly blood orange.

It might sound like fantasy, but here in my hometown Guayaquil, Ecuador, there is a man that has a lot of Pappy bottles and some other very, very fancy bourbouns, and he found out i was a whisky enthusiast and a critic, so he invited me to his house along with other friends to a tasting and i got to say, we drank some very, very, very fancy and expensive bourbon yesterday. 

I got drunk drinking pappy. Lots of it. The 12yo, the 15yo and the 20yo. I believe that my organs are now golden.

Well, lets do this. Pappy 20yo is as expensive as it is scarce. It is an unicorn. It is practically unreachable. I have had the 12yo (lot b) which was great and it was the favorite of the host of the tasting; and, i have had the 15yo (and had it again yesterday) and i got to say the 15yo is the best by far, making this 20yo the second best, because of something that some expensive old whiskies have: fancy tasting notes and easy drinkable character, but not the complexity we whisky enthusiasts/critics want.

45.2% abv, chesnut color. Beautiful. (90.4 proof actually).

On the nose it has a lot going on: Banana, Cherry, strawberry, Super refined and fancy vanilla, Prunes, lots of Maple syrup, Herbal Fresh forest notes. 

On the palate is very pleasant and easy drinkable. Maybe too easy drinkable. You just dont feel 45.2%abv is happening here due to its smoothness. 
Mostly oaky but in the most beautiful way, Herbal notes, a rye sweetness/spicyness, and Prunes. It could be better. 

Aftertaste is heavenly. Is where it gets all the points  Ashy and the most amazing ginger spiciness ever. Eternal aftertaste. Amazing.

Very balanced, very well crafted. Overall i give this superb bourbon a 96 over 100, and ill stick to Pappy 15yo. Slainte my friends!
Not sure if it’s because of the mystique but it was amazing. It was rich, had complex depth, with some butterscotch and vanilla. I am completely untrained at this but that’s what I got.
Lucked into a free taste of his as well a month ago, damn good but 12 yr was better!
Smooth, delicious. As good as expected.
Just preference but the 20 year starts picking up too much of the barrel and the sweetness is diminished.  I prefer the 12 and 15 over 20.
Sweet, caramel front. Orange vanilla. Early bite. Smooths out quick. Nutty, spicy finish.

The nose smells like it has a much higher ABV.  Lots of spice. 

With all that spice on the nose and the expectation of a strong kick in the mouth, I was surprised at how smooth it was. Almost as if I was smelling one whiskey and tasting a different one. 

The flavors and mouthfeel frankly make me question what all the hype is about. For what was there, it is not worth $75 a pour. 

Don't get me wrong. It is still a good whiskey. I am glad I was able to try it. I was just expecting more. I cannot find the justification for charging $75 for a pour of something that frankly doesn't taste better than a $40 bottle of something else.
Oak and Carmel with a slight cherry taste. Definitely a bucket list check off. 1oz pour

My one and only bottle of this was purchased way before the Pappy craze.  I paid $100 for it, and I hid the fact from my wife.  Upon fist sip, I thought to myself “holy mother of God this is effing gooooood bourbon”.
A cult classic. Get it when you can. Otherwise it will vanish. Carmel, oak, nutty. Smooth and tasty. (Over proves though otherwise it would be 5 stars.)
Incredibly smooth. Was prepared for it to be overhyped, it wasn’t. Unlikely to be able to afford it again, but incredibly tasty.
